segment.source: How to Configure Web Settings for a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Configure Web Settings for a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Configure Web Settings for a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Configure Web Settings for a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: How to Configure Web Settings for a MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Configure Web Settings for a MED-V Workspace

segment.source: Web sites that can only be displayed in older versions of Internet Explorer and that do not exist in the host operating system can be viewed in older versions of Internet Explorer within the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Web sites that can only be displayed in older versions of Internet Explorer and that do not exist in the host operating system can be viewed in older versions of Internet Explorer within the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: The user does not need to open a browser in the MED-V workspace to view the specified Web sites.
segment.target: The user does not need to open a browser in the MED-V workspace to view the specified Web sites.

segment.source: The user can open a browser on the host and automatically be redirected to the MED-V workspace and vice versa.
segment.target: The user can open a browser on the host and automatically be redirected to the MED-V workspace and vice versa.

segment.source: The following procedures describe how you can set a list of Web browsing rules for a MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The following procedures describe how you can set a list of Web browsing rules for a MED-V workspace.

segment.source: All sites included in the rules can be browsed either in the MED-V workspace or on the host, as defined by the administrator.
segment.target: All sites included in the rules can be browsed either in the MED-V workspace or on the host, as defined by the administrator.

segment.source: All sites not defined within the rules are browsed from the environment in which they were requested.
segment.target: All sites not defined within the rules are browsed from the environment in which they were requested.

segment.source: However, you can configure them as a group as well, to be browsed in the MED-V workspace or the host.
segment.target: However, you can configure them as a group as well, to be browsed in the MED-V workspace or the host.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Web settings are applied only to Internet Explorer and to no other browsers.
segment.target: Web settings are applied only to Internet Explorer and to no other browsers.

segment.source: All Web settings are configured in the Policy module, on the Web tab.
segment.target: All Web settings are configured in the Policy module, on the Web tab.

segment.source: How to Configure Web Settings for the MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Configure Web Settings for the MED-V Workspace

segment.source: To configure Web settings for the MED-V workspace
segment.target: To configure Web settings for the MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click the MED-V workspace to be configured.
segment.target: Click the MED-V workspace to be configured.

segment.source: Select the Browse the list of URLs defined in the following table check box to redirect the user to a browser within the MED-V workspace or host, when the user browses to a URL that conforms to the Web rules specified.
segment.target: Select the Browse the list of URLs defined in the following table check box to redirect the user to a browser within the MED-V workspace or host, when the user browses to a URL that conforms to the Web rules specified.

segment.source: Click one of the following:
segment.target: Click one of the following:

segment.source: In the Workspace—Redirect to a browser in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: In the Workspace—Redirect to a browser in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: In the host—Redirect to a browser on the host.
segment.target: In the host—Redirect to a browser on the host.

segment.source: Select the Browse all other URLs check box to redirect all URLs excluded from the Web rules to the host or MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Select the Browse all other URLs check box to redirect all URLs excluded from the Web rules to the host or MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Click one of the following:
segment.target: Click one of the following:

segment.source: In the Workspace—Redirect all other URLs to a browser in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: In the Workspace—Redirect all other URLs to a browser in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: In the host—Redirect all other URLs to a browser on the host.
segment.target: In the host—Redirect all other URLs to a browser on the host.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: How to Add a Web Rule
segment.target: How to Add a Web Rule

segment.source: To add a Web rule
segment.target: To add a Web rule

segment.source: Select the Browse the list of URLs defined in the following table check box to enable the Web browsing rules.
segment.target: Select the Browse the list of URLs defined in the following table check box to enable the Web browsing rules.

segment.source: Click Add.
segment.target: Click Add.

segment.source: A new Web rule is added.
segment.target: A new Web rule is added.

segment.source: Configure the Web rule properties as described in the following table.
segment.target: Configure the Web rule properties as described in the following table.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: MED-V Workspace Web Properties
segment.target: MED-V Workspace Web Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Type
segment.target: Type

segment.source: Domain suffix—Access to any host address ending with the suffix specified in the Value property and is set according to the option set in Web Browsing.
segment.target: Domain suffix—Access to any host address ending with the suffix specified in the Value property and is set according to the option set in Web Browsing.

segment.source: IP Prefix—Access to any full or partial IP address in the range of the prefix specified in the Value property and is set according to the option set in Web Browsing.
segment.target: IP Prefix—Access to any full or partial IP address in the range of the prefix specified in the Value property and is set according to the option set in Web Browsing.

segment.source: All Local Addresses—Access to all addresses without a '.' and is set according to the option set in Web Browsing.
segment.target: All Local Addresses—Access to all addresses without a '.' and is set according to the option set in Web Browsing.

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: If Domain suffix is selected in the Type property, enter a domain suffix.
segment.target: If Domain suffix is selected in the Type property, enter a domain suffix.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Do not enter before the suffix.
segment.target: Do not enter before the suffix.

segment.source: Domain suffixes support aliases as well.
segment.target: Domain suffixes support aliases as well.

segment.source: If IP Prefix is selected in the Type property, enter a full or partial IP address.
segment.target: If IP Prefix is selected in the Type property, enter a full or partial IP address.

segment.source: How to Delete a Web Rule
segment.target: How to Delete a Web Rule

segment.source: To delete a Web rule
segment.target: To delete a Web rule

segment.source: In the Web pane, select the Web rule to delete.
segment.target: In the Web pane, select the Web rule to delete.

segment.source: Click Remove.
segment.target: Click Remove.

segment.source: The Web rule is deleted.
segment.target: The Web rule is deleted.
